summary: Rotterdam is the second-largest city in the Netherlands, located in South Holland province. It's a major economic hub and home to Europe's largest seaport. The city's history dates back to 1270 when a dam was built on the Rotte River. It received city rights in 1340. Today, Rotterdam is known for its diverse population, modern architecture, and cultural attractions. The city was almost entirely destroyed during World War II, leading to a unique blend of old and new buildings. It serves as a crucial transport gateway to Europe and the world.
title: Rotterdam
